text: The Philadelphia Phillies are a Major League Baseball team based in Philadelphia in the United States of America. Below are details about their 1984 playing season. == Offseason == * October 19, 1983: Pete Rose was released by the Phillies.Pete Rose at Baseball Reference * December 3, 1983: Ron Reed was traded by the Phillies to the Chicago White Sox for a player to be named later. The White Sox completed the deal by sending Jerry Koosman to the Phillies on February 15, 1984.Jerry Koosman at Baseball Reference * December 6, 1983: Tony Pérez was purchased from the Phillies by the Cincinnati Reds.Tony Pérez at Baseball Reference * January 30, 1984: Butch Benton was signed as a free agent by the Phillies.Butch Benton at Baseball Reference * March 24, 1984: Willie Hernández and Dave Bergman were traded by the Phillies to the Detroit Tigers for John Wockenfuss and Glenn Wilson.Willie Hernández at Baseball Reference === Spring training === The Phils went 13 and 16 in spring training exhibition play. The Phillies closed spring training with two games against the St. Louis Cardinals at the Louisiana Superdome on March 31, 1984, and April 1, 1984. == Regular season == === Season standings === ===Record vs. opponents=== === Notable transactions === * April 20, 1984: Butch Benton was released by the Phillies. * June 2, 1984: Dave Wehrmeister was signed as a free agent by the Phillies.Dave Wehrmeister at Baseball Reference * June 3, 1984: Jim Kern was signed as a free agent by the Phillies.Jim Kern at Baseball Reference * July 27, 1984: Jim Kern was released by the Phillies. * August 20, 1984: Kelly Downs and George Riley were traded by the Phillies to the San Francisco Giants for Al Oliver and a player to be named later. The Giants completed the deal by sending Renie Martin to the Phillies on August 30.Al Oliver at Baseball Reference ==== Draft picks ==== * June 4, 1984: 1984 Major League Baseball draft **Marvin Freeman was drafted by the Phillies in the 2nd round. Player signed June 14, 1984.Marvin Freeman at Baseball Reference **Todd Frohwirth was drafted by the Phillies in the 13th round.
